original_title: 3D Printing RC Car Tires To Go Fast
original_content:
Theres a bit of a high-speed arms race in the RC world on YouTube these days. [Michael Rectin] is in on the action, and hes been exploring how to 3D print a decent set of tires to help his RC car reach higher speeds mph.
His first efforts involved experiments with TPU. The tires looked okay, but had very little traction. He later moved on to VarioShore TPU, a filament capable of delivering various properties depending on the printing method. Printing for the softest, and thus grippiest, possible tires, [Michael] whipped up some sporty looking boots for his wheels.
His tires improved over  off-road RC tires in one major way. His design didnt suffer significant ballooning as the rotational velocity increased. However, the VarioShore material lacked grip compared to off-the-shelf rubber RC tires designed for high-speed use. The commercially-available tires also offered a smoother ride.
[Michael] also demonstrated some neat tricks for high-speed RC driving. He used a modified flight controller to correct the cars steering in response to perturbations, and put in a scaling method that reduces steering inputs at higher speed. That didnt entirely stop the carnage though, with some incidents seeing wheels thrown off in big tumbling crashes.
Electric-powered RC cars can go darn quick these days, but you might want to consider jet power if you want to break records. Video after the break.
title: 3DプリントされたタイヤでRCカーのスピードを向上させる方法について
body: RC世界で高速アームレースが行われており、[Michael Rectin]も参加しています。彼はRCカーのスピードを上げるために、3Dプリントでタイヤを作ろうと試みています。最初の試みでは、TPUを使用しましたが、グリップがほとんどありませんでした。その後、VarioShore TPUを使用し、印刷方法によってさまざまな特性を持つタイヤを作りました。ただし、市販のタイヤと比べてグリップが不足していました。彼はまた、高速RCドライブのために修正されたフライトコントローラーを使用しました。
titles: 3DプリントされたタイヤでRCカーのスピードを向上させる方法について
